item.title: Lenny Newsletter Product Pass 新增七个合作伙伴
item.description:
Lenny Newsletter Product Pass 新增七个合作伙伴

摘要

Lenny Newsletter 宣布其 Product Pass 新增七个高级合作伙伴，包括 Canva Business、ElevenLabs、Framer、Manus、Amp、Factory 和 Railway，订阅用户可免费获得价值超过 25000 美元的工具。这一捆绑包旨在帮助用户拥抱 AI 原生工具，避免被时代淘汰。

内容框架与概述

文章首先宣布 Lenny Newsletter Product Pass 新增七个合作伙伴，包括 Manus（Meta 的自主 AI 代理平台）、Amp（前沿编码代理）、Factory（软件开发 Droids）、Railway（智能云提供商）、Framer（设计优先的网站构建器）、Canva Business（视觉沟通平台）和 ElevenLabs Creator Plan（AI 创意平台），总价值超过 25000 美元。

作者解释了 Product Pass 的目标是让用户亲身体验最重要、最前沿、精心制作的产品，停止滚动浏览，开始构建。作者指出，拥抱这些神奇新工具并从中受益的人，与保持常规、被落在后面的人之间，差距正在拉大。作者的使命是确保你属于第一类人。

付费订阅让你获得世界上最受欢迎的产品通讯、播客和全球产品社区，现在还包括成为 AI 原生构建者所需的整个工具栈，每年只需 200-350 美元。

文章详细介绍了每个新产品：Manus 提供一年免费 4000 积分/月（240 美元价值），用于执行复杂任务的自主 AI 代理；Amp 提供一年每天 15 美元积分（1825 美元价值），用于终端和编辑器的前沿编码代理；Factory 提供一年免费 Pro 版（240 美元价值），用于构建软件 Droids；Railway 提供一年免费 Pro 版（240 美元价值），用于智能云托管；Framer 提供一年免费 Pro 版（360 美元价值），用于设计优先的网站构建；Canva Business 提供一年免费（200 美元价值，仅限 Insider 订阅者）；ElevenLabs 提供 Creator Plan 一年免费（264 美元价值，仅限 Insider 订阅者）。

item.title: Learn the power of other mathematicians’ tools
item.description:
中文版本

https://terrytao.wordpress.com/career-advice/learn-the-power-of-other-mathematicians-tools/

Learn the power of other mathematicians’ tools

I suppose it is tempting, if the only tool you have is a hammer, to treat everything as if it were a nail.

— Abraham Maslow, “Psychology of Science”

You will find, when listening to talks or reading papers, that there will be problems which interest you which were solved using an unfamiliar tool, but seem out of reach of your own personal “bag of tricks”. When this happens, you should try to see whether your own tools can in fact accomplish a similar task, but you should also try to work out what made the other tool so effective – for instance, to locate the simplest model case in which that tool does something non-trivial.

item.title: Learn the limitations of your tools
item.description:
中文版本

https://terrytao.wordpress.com/career-advice/learn-the-limitations-of-your-tools/

Learn the limitations of your tools

An education isn’t how much you have committed to memory, or even how much you know. It’s being able to differentiate between what you do know and what you don’t.

Anatole France

Mathematical education (and research papers) tends to focus, naturally enough, on techniques that work. But it is equally important to know when the tools you have don’t work, so that you don’t waste time on a strategy which is doomed from the start, and instead go hunting for new tools to solve the problem (or hunt for a new problem).
